+# HIP_PATH
+IF(NOT DEFINED $ENV{HIP_PATH})
+  SET(HIP_PATH /opt/rocm/hip)
+ELSE()
+  SET(HIP_PATH $ENV{HIP_PATH})
+ENDIF()
+
+# HCC_PATH
+IF(NOT DEFINED $ENV{HCC_PATH})

+ELSE()
+  SET(HCC_PATH $ENV{HCC_PATH})
+ENDIF()
+
+# HIPBLAS_PATH
+IF(NOT DEFINED $ENV{HIPBLAS_PATH})
+  SET(HIPBLAS_PATH /opt/rocm/hipblas)
+ELSE()
+  SET(HIPBLAS_PATH $ENV{HIPBLAS_PATH})
+ENDIF()
+
+# HIPRNG_PATH
+IF(NOT DEFINED $ENV{HIPRNG_PATH})
+  SET(HIPRNG_PATH /opt/rocm/hcrng)
+ELSE()
+  SET(HIPRNG_PATH $ENV{HIPRNG_PATH})
+ENDIF()
+
+# HIPSPARSE_PATH
+IF(NOT DEFINED $ENV{HIPSPARSE_PATH})
+  SET(HIPSPARSE_PATH /opt/rocm/hcsparse)
+ELSE()
+  SET(HIPSPARSE_PATH $ENV{HIPSPARSE_PATH})
+ENDIF()
+
+SET(THRUST_PATH "/root/Thrust")
+
+# Add HIP to the CMAKE Module Path
+set(CMAKE_MODULE_PATH ${HIP_PATH}/cmake ${CMAKE_MODULE_PATH})

+# Find the HIP Package

body: Generally, the cmake file which is actually invoked by `find_package` is given the name `Find*.cmake`. This file is named like this but doesn't follow that convention. It would be clearer to name it something like `LoadHIP.cmake`; just don't use the Find convention.
